availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Weeden S. Yates (Barren County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Ermanella E. Yates. Father of Mary C. Yates Lockett, Elizabeth F. Yates, William T. Yates, John L. Yates, and Hellen C. Yates Franklin. Constable in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Barren County in 1850. Farmer in Barren County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 2, p. 448A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 2, p. 222.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 786.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 50A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Hiseville, p. 638B.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Green County Wills, vol. 1-5, 1796-1939, p. 32.
